230e8d2c-7068-4ebf-be53-e0386e0d01fd.description: Earners of the PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer certification have knowledge of the universal concepts of computer programming, the syntax and semantics of the Python language as well as demonstrate the ability to accomplish coding tasks related to the essentials of programming in the Python language and fundamental skills in resolving typical implementation challenges with the help of the Python Standard Library.
230e8d2c-7068-4ebf-be53-e0386e0d01fd.name: [PCEP-30-01] PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer

alignments.name: PCEP: Exam Syllabus
alignments.description: PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer certification shows that the individual is familiar with universal computer programming concepts like data types, containers, functions, conditions, loops, as well as Python programming language syntax, semantics, and the runtime environment.

alignments.name: PCEP: Testing Policies
alignments.description: OpenEDG Python Institute Test Candidates can register and take the PCEP exam online via the OpenEDG Testing Service Platform available at https://edube.org. OpenEDG Python Institute PCEP exam sessions do not need to be scheduled in advance, and test candidates can register for and take exams on the same day.

badge_template_activities.title: Achieve a passing score on the PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer certification exam

2ea11dea-21b7-4c7f-8b9c-e3e2d0936f76.description: Earners of the PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer certification have knowledge of the universal concepts of computer programming, the syntax and semantics of the Python language as well as demonstrate the ability to accomplish coding tasks related to the essentials of programming in the Python language and fundamental skills in resolving typical implementation challenges with the help of the Python Standard Library.
2ea11dea-21b7-4c7f-8b9c-e3e2d0936f76.name: [PCEP-30-02] PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer

alignments.name: PCEP-30-02: Exam Syllabus
alignments.description: PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer certification shows that the individual is familiar with universal computer programming concepts like data types, containers, functions, conditions, loops, exceptions, as well as Python 3 programming language syntax, semantics, and the runtime environment.

alignments.name: PCEP-30-02: Testing Policies
alignments.description: PCEP-30-02 test candidates must follow technical requirements and testing policies provided at https://pythoninstitute.org/pcep-testing-policies/. This includes compliance with the code of honor and respecting the specific rules for taking the exam.

badge_template_activities.title: OpenEDG Python Institute test candidates can register and take the PCEP-30-02 exam online via the OpenEDG Testing Service Platform available at https://edube.org.
Achieve a passing score on the PCEP – Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer certification exam (PCEP-30-02)

65165c85-3bb8-4e75-843a-ffae5841d270.description: Earners of the PCAP – Certified Associate in Python Programming badge demonstrate the ability to accomplish coding tasks related to the basics of programming in the Python language and the fundamental notions and techniques used in object-oriented programming. Becoming PCAP certified ensures that the individual is fully acquainted with all the primary means provided by Python 3 to enable her/him to start her/his own studies, and to open a path to the developer’s career.
65165c85-3bb8-4e75-843a-ffae5841d270.name: [PCAP-31-03] PCAP – Certified Associate in Python Programming

alignments.name: PCAP-31-03: Exam Syllabus
alignments.description: PCAP – Certified Associate in Python Programming certification shows that the individual is familiar with general computer programming concepts like conditional execution, loops, Python programming language syntax, semantics, and the runtime environment, as well as with general coding techniques and Object-Oriented Programming.

alignments.name: PCAP-31-03: Testing Policies
alignments.description: OpenEDG Python Institute Test Candidates can register and take the PCAP-31-03 exam through the Network of Pearson VUE Testing Centers/OnVUE Online Proctoring from Pearson VUE. The exam should be scheduled at least one full business day (24 hours) in advance. More information: www.pearsonvue.com/pythoninstitute

d3de9fdb-9c7d-4fc6-b163-c70920212cbb.description: Earners of the PCPP1 – Certified Professional in Python Programming 1 badge demonstrate that they are proficient in the following topic areas: 1) advanced use of classes and features of object-oriented programming, 2) graphical user interface programming, 3) networking and using RESTful APIs, 4) working with selected library modules (sqlite3, xml, csv, logging, configparser 5) the best practices, standardization, and coding conventions used in the Python language.
d3de9fdb-9c7d-4fc6-b163-c70920212cbb.name: [PCPP-32-101] PCPP1 – Certified Professional in Python Programming 1

alignments.name: PCPP-32-101: Exam Syllabus
alignments.description: Becoming PCPP1 certified ensures that the individual is fully acquainted with all the essential means provided by Python 3 and related technologies to enable her/him to advance her/his career as a professional Python developer and continue studies at the advanced level.

alignments.name: PCPP1: Testing Policies
alignments.description: OpenEDG Python Institute Test Candidates can register and take the PCPP1 exam through the Network of Pearson VUE Testing Centers. The exam should be scheduled at least one full business day (24 hours) in advance. More information: www.pearsonvue.com/pythoninstitute
